page.title: 15Farming and Forestry
page.content: Woodland:3 large woods on Hoddington land at Little Park,Dean Copse and Humbly Grove approx. 2 sq kms decid- uous.Smaller mostly conifer copses are windbreaks. Forestry Commission: 62 hectares on Weston Common which is an experimental plantation.This has 8 hectares Douglas Fir planted 1948/9 + 1963 and various experimental plots of conifer species. 54 hectares of mainly deciduous including 18 hectares-the largest block in South England-of the Southern Beech (Nothofagus Procera) planted in 1948/9. Norway Maple 1949 and Wild Cherry 1963 also various experimental plots of different deciduous species. Soil:Chalk down- land with clay caps and many flints, but soil at Powntley Copse is lime- free and able to grow azaleas etc. Housing on farms : 1 lived in farm and only 5 farm cottages.
